Class StaccatoMidiEventFactory

java.lang.Object
factory.StaccatoMidiEventFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
MidiEventFactory
public class StaccatoMidiEventFactory extends Object implements MidiEventFactory
Staccato implementation of the MidiEventFactory interface. Creates MIDI events with shortened note duration for a sharp, detached sound. Implements the staccato playing style by moving Note Off events earlier.

  • Method Details

    • createNoteOn

      public MidiEvent createNoteOn(int tick, int note, int velocity, int channel) throws InvalidMidiDataException
      Creates a standard Note On MIDI event at the specified tick. The staccato style is achieved by shortening the note duration in the Note Off event.
      Specified by:
      createNoteOn in interface MidiEventFactory
      Parameters:
      tick - The time in ticks when the note starts
      note - The MIDI note number (0-127)
      velocity - The velocity (volume) of the note (0-127)
      channel - The MIDI channel (0-15)
      Returns:
      A MIDI event for the Note On message
      Throws:
      InvalidMidiDataException - If any parameter is invalid for MIDI specification

    • createNoteOff

      public MidiEvent createNoteOff(int tick, int note, int channel) throws InvalidMidiDataException
      Creates an earlier Note Off MIDI event to achieve staccato (short, detached) effect. Shortens the note duration by moving the Note Off event 120 ticks earlier, but not before 0.
      Specified by:
      createNoteOff in interface MidiEventFactory
      Parameters:
      tick - The time in ticks when the note would normally end
      note - The MIDI note number (0-127) to turn off
      channel - The MIDI channel (0-15)
      Returns:
      A MIDI event for the earlier Note Off message
      Throws:
      InvalidMidiDataException - If any parameter is invalid for MIDI specification
